intro: Jasione crispa subsp. varduliensis, commonly known as the Varduliensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue to violet flowers. The species belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. It typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is adapted to temperate climates. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
